lib/uart.c File Reference

Handles communication via uart (polling mode). Is only included if compiled with -DDEBUG_UART. More...

#include <msg_queue.h>
#include <freebus-debug.h>
#include <fb_hardware.h>

Data Structures

struct  uart_cmds
 Data is written in background to not block other operations, data and control bytes are stored in that structure. More...

Defines

#define FF_CLOCK   8000000L
 use here own variable because avr studio always set F_CPU to 8000000UL so calculation will fail
#define BAUD   38400L
 baud rate, the L at the end is important, DO NOT use UL!
#define UBRR_VAL   ((FF_CLOCK+BAUD*8)/(BAUD*16)-1)
 round clever
#define BAUD_REAL   (FF_CLOCK/(16*(UBRR_VAL+1)))
 real baud rate
#define BAUD_ERROR   ((BAUD_REAL*1000)/BAUD-1000)
 error rate in promile
#define DEBUG_MSG_MAX_LEN   MSG_MAX_DATA_LENGTH-2
 max length a debug message can have

Detailed Description

Handles communication via uart (polling mode). Is only included if compiled with -DDEBUG_UART.

Author:
Dirk Opfer, Matthias Fechner
Date:
Fri Oct 26 17:18:15 2007

real baud rate

round clever

Function Documentation

uint8_t AppendToQueue ( struct msg *  current,
uint8_t  length,
uint8_t *  character 
)

Take the given char and append it to a debug message queue or allocate a new message container and store it there.

That function was written to use the memory for debugging message more efficient.

Parameters:
current Pointer to the message queue
length Length of characters to append to the message queue
character Pointer to characters to store in the message queue
Returns:

References uart_cmds::count, uart_cmds::data, msg::data, DEBUG_MSG_MAX_LEN, DISABLE_IRQS, ENABLE_IRQS, MSG_ALLOC, MSG_SENDING, msg::next, uart_cmds::offset, and msg::state.

Referenced by uart_putc().

ISR ( SIG_UART_TRANS   ) 

ISR is called if rs232 is empty and can store the next byte.

static void trigger_uart ( void   )  [inline, static]

Start the send progress and write all queued data to rs232 interface.

Trigger here the first byte and enable ISQ for sending.

References uart_cmds::data, msg::data, ENABLE_UART_TX_IRQ, MSG_ALLOC, MSG_SENDING, uart_cmds::offset, msg::state, and UART_SEND_BYTE.

void uart_puts ( const char *  s  ) 

Display string on rs232.

The strings are saved on flash and not in sram. See here definition of DEBUG_PUTS on freebus-debug.h.

Parameters:
s String pointer which points to flash

References uart_putc().

Here is the call graph for this function:
